author: Robert Kinsella

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Diorite (Pebble 2) and Emery (Pebble Time 2), minor improvements
Fix for saving connection details from the configuration screen - if you were having issues connection, try reconnecting again
Fix for the calorie calculation when storing weight in pounds
Fix for automatic syncing error on app load

- Rewritten the authentication process due to required Fitbit changes - if you have issues syncing data after the update, try reconnecting the account (also, some configuration data may need to be set again)
- Fix for timezone offsets on Aplite devices using SDK3
- Other minor fixes / updates

- Added the ability to set a weekly measurement reminder via an app wake-up (set this in the settings page)
- Bug fixes

- Complete rewrite of back-end code in preparation for additional services
- Configuration screen now uses the Slate front-end framework
- Added the option to display / input measurements as whole numbers only

- Fitbit fix for submission issue experienced by some users who were in a negative timezone
- Various optimisation updates

- Added support for Pebble Round
- Calculations now show Lean Body Mass
- Updated sync screen

- Improvements on first use for Google Fit connected users 
- Bug fixes

- Added minimum and maximum statistic values according to the limits imposed by Fitbit
- Switching between measurement units will now convert the current values
- Adding / updating an account connection will now perform a sync immediately after sending to the app
- Bug fixes

Fixed bugs introduced in the previous update where:
- saved configuration settings from the Pebble app would not persist
- there would be an error syncing with Google Fit for new users

description:
Store your current weight, height and body fat measurements on your Pebble watch.

- Connect your Google Fit / Fitbit accounts to sync your statistics through the Watchapp settings section of the Pebble phone app
- Use your statistics to calculate your daily calorie intake (currently using the Katch-Mcardle formula)
- Set a weekly measurement remind via an app wake up

Connected account notes:

Google Fit - currently only your weight and height can be synced through Google Fit

Fitbit - your weight and body fat can be synced through your Fitbit account, your height will only be sent to Fitbit as there is no date stored against the height in the account. Fitbit will only return data for up to 31 days so if you haven't updated in that period the app will not be able to download that data.

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Diorite (Pebble 2) and Emery (Pebble Time 2), minor improvements

title: Health Sync
